physical_appearance: This is a black-and-white photograph. It features a man, standing in the middle of an uneven field, holding a hockey stick. He is dressed in a white shirt and black shorts. Behind him, there is a roofed house. The edges of the photograph are uneven. There is a small crease on the top right corner of the photograph.
sgcool_label_text: A variety of portraits of British soldiers that show them at leisure as well as two photographs of James Steele placing a wreath at a remembrance ceremony, this collection is part of the archive of James Steele, Royal Artillery (Field) who served in Malaya from January 1941-February 1942, when interned as a P.O.W at Changi until his release in October 1945.
title_text: Group of 50 photographs of P.O.W James Steele and regiment when stationed in Malaysia in 1941 (and 2 later photographs of Steele placing a wreath at ceremony of remembrance)  L/Bde Leeming, Mersing 1941
subject_terms_2: World War, 1939-1945 Soldiers Photography Hockey sticks
context_7: Great Britain. Army. Royal Field Artillery
